translation.text: You Yourself are the hero, exerting Your regal power.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਆਪੇ ਸਿਵ ਵਰਤਾਈਅਨੁ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਆਪੇ ਸੀਤਲੁ ਠਾਰੁ ਗੜਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: You Yourself spread peace within; You are cool and icy calm. ||13||

transliteration.text: āpē siv varatāīan antar āpē sītal thār garā .13.

text: ਤਿਸ ਹੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਤਿਸ ਹੀ ਠਕੁਰਾਈ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਨ ਆਵੈ ਜਮੁ ਨੇੜਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: He is peaceful, and he is the master of all; the Messenger of Death does not even approach him. ||14||

transliteration.text: tis hī sukh tis hī thakurāī tisah n āvai jam nērā .14.

text: ਆਦਿ ਮਧਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਸੋਈ ਹਾਥਿ ਤਿਸੈ ਕੈ ਨੇਬੇੜਾ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: In the beginning, in the middle and in the end, God exists. Judgement is in His Hands alone. ||15||

transliteration.text: ād madh ant prabh sōī hāth tisai kai nēbērā .15.

text: ਕਿਸ ਹੀ ਬੁਤੈ ਜਬਾਬੁ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥

translation.text: No one can stand up against Him by any means.

transliteration.text: kis hī butai jabāb n hōī .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਕਾ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਆਪੇ ਆਪੇ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਖੈ ਚੋਜ ਖੜਾ ॥੧੬॥੧॥੧੦॥

translation.text: Nanak's God is Himself all-in-all. He creates and stages and watches His wondrous plays. ||16||1||10||

transliteration.text: nānak kā prabh āpē āpē kar kar vēkhai chōj kharā .16.1.10.

text: ਜਗਜੀਵਨ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਘਟ ਘਟ ਵਾਸੀ ਹੈ ਸੰਗਾ ॥੨॥

transliteration.text: jagajīvan abināsī thākur ghat ghat vāsī hai sangā .2.

text: ਬਾਵਨ ਰੂਪੁ ਕੀਆ ਤੁਧੁ ਕਰਤੇ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਸੇਤੀ ਹੈ ਚੰਗਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: O Creator, You assumed the form of the pygmy to humble the demons; You are the Lord God of all. ||3||

transliteration.text: bāvan rūp kīā tudh karatē sabh hī sētī hai changā .3.

translation.text: You are the Great Raam Chand, who has no form or feature.

text: ਸਹਸ ਨੇਤ੍ਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਹੈ ਸਹਸਾ ਇਕੁ ਦਾਤਾ ਸਭ ਹੈ ਮੰਗਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: You have thousands of eyes, and thousands of forms. You alone are the Giver, and all are beggars of You. ||4||

transliteration.text: kamalākant karah kantūhal anad binōdī nihasangā .6.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The Blessed Vision of His Darshan is fruitful and rewarding; He is not born, He is self-existent.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਅਕਾਲ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਜਿਸੁ ਕਦੇ ਨਾਹੀ ਖਉ ॥

translation.text: His form is undying; it is never destroyed.

transliteration.text: akāl mūrat jis kadē nāhī khau .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਅਬਿਗਤ ਅਗੋਚਰ ਸਭੁ ਕਿਛੁ ਤੁਝ ਹੀ ਹੈ ਲਗਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: O imperishable, eternal, unfathomable Lord, everything is attached to You. ||7||

transliteration.text: abināsī abigat agōchar sabh kish tujh hī hai lagā .7.

translation.text: The Lover of greatness, who dwells in heaven.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: By the Pleasure of His Will, He took incarnation as the great fish and the tortoise.

text: ਕੇਸਵ ਚਲਤ ਕਰਹਿ ਨਿਰਾਲੇ ਕੀਤਾ ਲੋੜਹਿ ਸੋ ਹੋਇਗਾ ॥੮॥

translation.text: The Lord of beauteous hair, the Worker of miraculous deeds, whatever He wishes, comes to pass. ||8||

transliteration.text: kēsav chalat karah nirālē kītā lōrah sō hōigā .8.

translation.text: He is beyond need of any sustenance, free of hate and all-pervading.

translation.text: He has staged His play; He is called the four-armed Lord.

text: ਸਾਵਲ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਰੂਪ ਬਣਾਵਹਿ ਬੇਣੁ ਸੁਨਤ ਸਭ ਮੋਹੈਗਾ ॥੯॥

translation.text: He assumed the beautiful form of the blue-skinned Krishna; hearing His flute, all are fascinated and enticed. ||9||

transliteration.text: sāval sundar rūp banāvah bēn sunat sabh mōhaigā .9.

text: ਸੰਖ ਚਕ੍ਰ ਗਦਾ ਹੈ ਧਾਰੀ ਮਹਾ ਸਾਰਥੀ ਸਤਸੰਗਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: He carries the conch, the chakra and the war club; He is the Great Charioteer, who stays with His Saints. ||10||

transliteration.text: sankh chakr gadā hai dhārī mahā sārathī satasangā .10.

text: ਸਾਰਿੰਗਧਰ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਬੀਠੁਲਾ ਮੈ ਗਣਤ ਨ ਆਵੈ ਸਰਬੰਗਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: The Archer who draws the bow, the Beloved Lord God; I cannot count all His limbs. ||11||

transliteration.text: sāringadhar bhagavān bīthulā mai ganat n āvai sarabangā .11.
